Game.Name: F1 2002 (Europe) (En,Fr,De,Es,It)
Game.plot: The Teams and DriversThe game features all 25 drivers and 11 teams that took part in the 2002 season. Scuderia Ferrari Marlboro: Micheal Schumacher - GermanyRubens Barrichello - Brazil West Mclaren Mercedes: David Coulthard - ScotlandKimi Raikkonen - Finland BMW Williams F1: Ralf Schumacher - GermanyJaun Pablo Montoya - Colombia Sauber Petronas: Felipe Massa - BrazilNick Heidfeld - Germany DHL Jordan Honda: Giancarlo Fisichella - ItalyTakuma Sato - Japan BAR Honda: Jacques Villeneuve - CanadaOlivier Panis - France Renault F1 Team: Jarno Trulli - Italy Jenson Button - England Jaguar Racing: Eddie Irvine - EnglandPedro de la Rosa - Spain Orange Arrows: Heinz-Harald Frentzen - Germany Enrique Bernoldi - Brazil Minardi Asiatech: Alex Yoong - MalaysiaMark Webber - Australia Panasonic Toyota Racing : Mika Salo - Finland Allan McNish - Scotland The Circuits The game featured all 17 tracks from the 2002 racing calender, with the option of varying number of laps upto the real life amount. Australian Grand Prix - Melbourne - 58 Laps Malaysian Grand Prix - Sepang - 56 Laps Brazilian Grand Prix - Interlagos - 71 Laps San Marino Grand Prix - Imola - 62 Laps Spanish Grand Prix - Catalunya - 65 Laps Austrian Grand Prix - A1-Ring - 69 Laps Monaco Grand Prix - Monaco - 78 Laps Canadian Grand Prix - Circuit Gilles Villeneuve - 70 Laps European Grand Prix - Nürburgring - 62 Laps British Grand Prix - Silverstone - 60 Laps French Grand Prix - Magny-Cours - 70 Laps German Grand Prix - Hockenheimring - 60 Laps Hungarian Grand Prix - Hungaroring - 70 Laps Belgian Grand Prix - Spa-Francorchamps - 44 Laps Italian Grand Prix - Monza - 53 Laps United States Grand Prix - Indianapolis - 73 Laps Japanese Grand Prix - Suzuka - 53 Laps
Game.Notes: Handheld racer, features a smooth framerate for great controllability and a strong sense of speed. Cars are based on physical model settings: tires, aero, gearbox, and brakes. The developers endowed the machines with accurate characteristics for gears, max speed, rpm max, and engine curves. Thanks to the official FIA license, players will find 17 real circuits, 11 teams and 22 official drivers. The game also features race incidents (crashes, withdrawals, engine breakdowns, real-time broken records), an audio engine simulating up to 4 engines at the same time (gears, power, Doppler effects), and two difficulty settings. Players can modify car assistance and other pilots' skills and speed and choose from four game modes: Race, Season 2002, Custom Championship and Multiplayer.
